page.title: 07SATURDAY FAMILY LIFE IN LYMM
page.content: On a Saturday, life is mixed. I lie in bed until 9.OO am reading and feeling hungry. Shouting penetrates my mind as babies play in the next room. My mother enters with a pot of tea at last. Now I jump out of bed and dress hurriedly. Breakfast awaits my empty stomach. Cereal and toast make a good meal. After breakfast I help my mother feed the babies and play with them. At lOam I do my homework and then I watch television. Lunch consists of vegetable soup. I go out after lunch to play with my friends. Sometimes I go to the fish and chip shop for dinner, but most Saturdays I have pizza, salad and chips. After tea I use my computer, and play with the children. I watch television for most of the evening and I read until at last I go to bed.
